newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nisshin Steel sees 97/98 parent current prft flat.
newsitem.headline: Nisshin Steel sees 97/98 parent current prft flat.

text.p: Nisshin Steel Co Ltd said on Friday it hopes to maintain parent current profit for the 1997/98 business year, starting on April 1, at the same level as the current year.

Nisshin said earlier on Friday it estimated parent current profit of about six billion yen for the current year, down from a November forecast of 10 billion yen, against an actual 15.15 billion yen the previous year.
It also said it estimated group net profit for 1996/97 at seven billion yen, down from an actual 15 billion last year, senior managing director Toshihiro Okuyama told reporters.
Okuyama also said Nisshin expected 1996/97 group sales of 460 billion yen, slightly up from an actual 455.3 billion yen last year.
He said he expected a tough business environment next year, because Nisshin had no non-steel business, unlike other major steelmakers.
Markets for its main business line of thin sheet and stainless steel were still weak. It does not make thick plate or pipes, the markets for which are showing a recovery, he said.
He also said the weaker yen was a negative factor for the company, and the cost of its imports of raw materials exceeded by $100 million the value of its exports in the current year.
Nisshin plans capital spending of 22 billion yen in 1997/98, down from an estimated 24 billion yen in the current year.
